was a little scary at first because it's
so invasive you have so many people
coming through your house with lots of
equipment a day of setup where they come
in and they're trying to plan what
they're going to do they'll move out
your furniture and then usually it's a
day maybe a day and a half of shooting
and it can be a full day you know they
come at six o'clock in the morning
generally and often they won't leave
till eleven o'clock or midnight after we
got a little more savvy we realized make
other plans be out of the house as much
as possible because there's going to be
some degree of chaos but the payoff is
very good we always try to ear market
for something to improve our house which
is which is really a luxury and very
lucky my best payday ever was a
law-and-order shoot and they had to
build a wall were none existed between
these two rooms they shot one scene they
dismantled the wall and they were out of
the house by four o'clock and we got
eight thousand dollars I think there's a
big effort made by the crews to not
create too much disturbance for
surrounding neighbors but inevitably
somebody gets upset you're never
prepared for the sounds of the
18-wheelers driving down your small
street and scratching the branches of
the trees and outcome all the equipment
spilling out of the back of their trucks
and all of the cables that start
actually down the block and around the
corner and then make their way up the
street and into your house they wake me
up at seven o'clock in the morning
before I really want to get up with
noise sometimes they walk in my lawn
when you know they don't pay super close
attention to that some neighbor is gonna
have to have the porta potty out in
front of their house someone is going to
be woken up later at night because of
lights shining on the neighbor's house
trying to create a day scene at eleven
o'clock at night our neighborhood I
think did a really smart thing in that
we set up a trust generally the
production company will give a donation
to our our association our neighborhood
association which is which is wonderful
it allows us to do other things for the

beautification projects cleaning
graffiti that sort of thing the only
thing I'll say about Ditmas Park that
can be tough is the driveways
everybody's gotta drive way out here
which is if you live in New York a
driveway is a luxury you know when you
bring a big production out here and you
have the long trailers and the honey
wagons and the equipment trucks in New
York City you can just take blocks and
block
parking because there's no driveways and

really careful in really particular
about people's driveways and a lot of
times you could spend a week just out
here buying people's driveways to park
all of your trucks it's not usually your
immediate neighbor who's getting their
